contrast¶

\[C_{hkl} = \sum_{i,k}^{3} \sum_{j,l}^{2} G_{ijkl} E_{ijkl}\]

Created on Fri Jun 3 10:06:56 2022

@author: pmetz1

contrast.MLS¶

class pymls.contrast.MLS(dislocation: Dislocation | None = None, cij: ndarray | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Implements the geometric and elastic portions of the MLS contrast factor calculation

\[C_{hkl} = \sum_{i,m} \sum_{j,n} G_{ijmn} E_{ijmn}\]

Reference¶

Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, & Scardi (2009) “A general approach for

determining the diffraction contrast factor of straight-line dislocations.” Acta Cryst. A65, 109–119. doi:10.1107/S010876730804186X

Chkl(s: ndarray) → float[source]¶
\[C_{hkl} = \sum_{i,m}^{3} \sum_{j,n}^{2} G_{ijmn} E_{ijmn}\]
Parameters:

s (np.ndarray) – Diffraction vector (3,).

Returns:

Dislocation contrast factor for the diffraction vector hkl.

Return type:

float

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 9, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property D: ndarray¶
\[D_{\alpha} = - \frac{(L_{\alpha} \cdot b_{v})}{|b_{v}|(A_{\alpha} \cdot L_{\alpha})}\]

where \(A_{\alpha}\) and \(L_{\alpha}\) are equal to the a and b Stroh eigenvectors.

NB this differs from Stroh’s D_alpha coefficients by \(1/|\vec{b}|\)

Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a,) -> (3,) complex (length**-1)

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 13, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property Eijmn: ndarray¶
\[E_{ijmn} = \Sigma_{\alpha, \alpha'}^{3} \Psi_{\alpha}^{\alpha'} \Phi_{ij\alpha}^{mn\alpha'} \left[ \cos(\Delta_{\alpha}^{mn} + x_{\alpha}) \cos(\Delta_{ij}^{\alpha'} - y_{\alpha}^{\alpha'}) + \sin(\Delta_{\alpha}^{mn}) \sin(\Delta_{ij}^{\alpha'} - z_{\alpha}^{\alpha'}) \right]\]
Returns:

Elastic component of the dislocation contrast factor.

Return type:

np.ndarray (i,j,m,n) == (3,2,3,2) real valued and positive

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 17, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property F: ndarray¶
\[F(p_{\alpha}) = ( \Re[p_{\alpha}] - \Re[p_{\alpha}^`] )^2 + ( \Im[p_{\alpha}] - \Im[p_{\alpha}^`] )^2\]
Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a, a`) -> (3, 3) real

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 26, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

Gijmn(s: ndarray) → ndarray[source]¶

\(G_{ijmn} = \tau_i \tau_j \tau_m \tau_n\).

See pymls.contrast.Dislocation.Gijmn.

Parameters:

  • (3 (np.ndarray) – Diffraction vector.

  • ) – Diffraction vector.

Returns:

Gijmn – Product of direction cosines \(\tau_i\).

Return type:

np.ndarray (i, j, m, n) == (3, 2, 3, 2) real float

property Q: ndarray¶
\[Q(p_{\alpha}) = (|p_{\alpha}|^2 - |p_{\alpha^`}|^2 )^2 + 4 (Re[p_{\alpha}] - Re[p_{\alpha^`}]) (|p_{\alpha^`}|^2 Re[p_{\alpha}] - |p_{\alpha}|^2 Re[p_{\alpha^`}])\]
Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a, a`) == (3, 3) real

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 26, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property delta: ndarray¶

\(\Delta_{\alpha}^{mn} = arg(A_{m \alpha} D_{\alpha} p_{\alpha}^{(n-1)})\)

for

\(\alpha \in 1,2,3, m \in 1,2,3, n \in 1,2\)

NB (n-1) is an exponent (rather than an index) resulting from evaluation of the partial differentials (Martinez-Garcia et al. eqn. 15)

\(\frac{\partial}{\partial x_n} ln(x_1 + p_{\alpha} x_2)\)

Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a, m, n) == (3, 3, 2) radians

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 26, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property gamma1: ndarray¶
\[\Gamma_1( \alpha ) = Im[p_{\alpha}] Im[p_{\alpha^`}] [tan(x_{\alpha}) + tan(x_{\alpha^`})]\]
Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a, a`) == (3, 3) radians

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 27, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property gamma2: ndarray¶
\[\Gamma_2( \alpha ) = |p_{\alpha}|^2 - Re[p_{\alpha}] Re[_{\alpha^`}] + Im[p_{\alpha}] Im[p_{\alpha^`}]\]
Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a, a`) == (3, 3) radians

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 27, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property phi: ndarray¶
\[\Phi_{ij\alpha}^{mn\alpha^`} = 2 |A_{i\alpha}||A_{i\alpha^`}||D_{\alpha}||D_{\alpha^`}||P_{\alpha}^{(j-1)}||P_{\alpha^`}^{(n-1)}|\]

NB (n-1) is an exponent resulting from evaluation of the partial differentials (rather than an index)

\[\frac{\partial}{\partial x_n} ln(x_1 + p_{\alpha} x_2)\]
Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (i,j,a,m,n,a`) == (3,2,3,3,2,3) real valued.

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 18.2, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property psi: ndarray¶
\[\begin{split}\Psi_{\alpha}^{\alpha'} = & \frac{ \left|p_{\alpha}\right| }{2 \Im{\left[p_{\alpha}\right]^{2}} }\; & if\ \alpha = \alpha' \\ & \frac{ \left|p_{\alpha}\right| }{ \Im{\left[p_{\alpha}\right]} } \left[\frac{F(p_{\alpha})}{Q(p_{\alpha})}\right]^{1/2}\; & if\ \alpha \ne \alpha' \\\end{split}\]
Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a, a`) == (3, 3) real valued.

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 18.1, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property x: ndarray¶

\(x = \arctan(\Re{(p)}/\Im{(p)})\)

Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a,) -> (3,) (radians)

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 26, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property y: ndarray¶

\(y = \arctan((\Re{(p_i)} - \Re{(p_j)}) / (\Im{(p_i)} + \Im{(p_j)}))\)

Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a,a`) -> (3,3) (radians)

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 26, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).

property z: ndarray¶

\(z = \arctan(\Gamma_1(\alpha) / \Gamma_2(\alpha))\)

Returns:

Component of \(E_{ijmn}\) calculation.

Return type:

np.ndarray (a,a`) -> (3,3) (radians)

Reference¶

c.f. eqn. 26, Martinez-Garcia, Leoni, Scardi (2009).
